title: SmallSat Alliance names new executive director
summary: Retired U.S. Marine Angel Smith replaces Steve Nixon as head of the small satellite industry group

title: GMV Completes Testing of its Multi-Use Moon Rover Concept
summary: Spanish company GMV has completed the final test campaign of its European Moon Rover System concept. The European Moon Rover System (EMRS) initiative is part of the European Space Agency’s European Exploration Envelope Programme (E3P). The goal of the EMRS initiative was to build and test full-scale functional prototypes of a multi-use robotic mobility system […]

title: NASA’s 21st Northrop Grumman Mission Launches Scientific Studies to Station
summary: NASA and its international partners are sending scientific investigations to the International Space Station on Northrop Grumman’s 21st commercial resupply services mission. Flying aboard the company’s Cygnus spacecraft are tests of water recovery technology and a process to produce stem cells in microgravity, studies of the effects of spaceflight on microorganism DNA and liver tissue […]

title: China wants 50 countries involved in its ILRS moon base
summary: China is aiming to work with 50 countries on its lunar south pole base program as efforts to attract partners continue.

title: ABL loses rocket after static-fire test
summary: ABL Space Systems says the rocket it planned to use for the company’s first launch in 18 months suffered “irrecoverable” damage in a fire after a test-firing, further delaying its return to flight.

title: Europe sees Ariane 6 launch as an end to its “launcher crisis”
summary: The European Space Agency is optimistic that its “launcher crisis” is behind it after the mostly successful inaugural launch of the Ariane 6 earlier this month.

title: Maxar Intelligence Releases First Images from Next Generation WorldView Legion Satellites
summary: Maxar Intelligence Releases First Images from Next Generation WorldView Legion Satellites

title: NASA Awards Launch Services Contract for NOAA’s JPSS-4 Mission
summary: NASA, on behalf of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), has selected SpaceX (Space Exploration Technologies Corporation) to provide launch services for NOAA’s JPSS-4 mission. The spacecraft is part of the multi-satellite cooperative Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS) program, a partnership between NASA and NOAA. This mission is the next satellite in the program, […]

title: NASA Rocket Discovers New Energization Process in Upper Atmosphere
summary: When it comes to discoveries about our upper atmosphere, it pays to know your surroundings. Using data from the Twin Rockets to Investigate Cusp Electrodynamics (TRICE-2) rocket launch, NASA scientist Francesca Di Mare and Gregory Howes from the University of Iowa studied waves traveling down Earth’s magnetic field lines into the polar atmosphere. These waves […]
